defs: = ಗಿದ್ದಗೆ.
a piece of cork, something made of cork or a similar stopper made of rubber, glass, etc., used as a stopper for a bottle, cask, etc.
to get (by effort, merit, chance, trick).
the grass Panicum maximum of Poaceae family; Guinea grass.
to score or mark the surface of with a nail or nails.
to remove by rubbing or scraping; to erase; to wipe out.
a watery discharge from a mucous membrane of the eyes; the rheum of the eye.
to throw here and there or strew loosely; to scatter.

(used to modify the verb as rotate, revolve, whirl, etc.) rapidly; swiftly.

to move (oneself) in a circular manner, rotate or spin rapidly.

a sound made by a bird's wings or a propeller; a whizzing or buzzing sound; whir.

any of the celestial objects with apparent motion (as the sun, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, etc.).
an intense desire.
any of the sixteen equal parts of something.
a circular, revolving contrivance with forms of animals to sit on, used as an amusement device for children.
an acrobatic stunt performed by jumping up and turning one full revolution in the air heels over head.
a turning or spinning motion around one's centre or axis; a rotation; a revolution.
a small hand-held toy, that whirls or spins when held against wind and makes a low rattling sound.
any of the four equal parts of something; a quarter; a fourth.
a part, portion of a whole.

a footwear that makes whir sound while walking with.

any of several diseases or toxic conditions of horses, cattle, etc., characterised by a loss of coordination, and by staggering, falling, etc.; staggers.
a disease, esp. of sheep or cattle, caused by the larvae of a tapeworm (Multiceps multiceps) in the brain or spinal cord; gid; sturdy.
to jump up and turn oneself one full vertical revolution in the air.
(the head) to feel dizzy; to have a sensation of spinning or whirling.
to turn (oneself) around.
(fig.) to get a grade of failure (as in school examination); to fail.
the sound made by dried leaves while being walked on.
a harsh, shrill, grating or squeaking sound (as made by a rusted hinge); creak.
a machine for separating cotton fibres from the seeds; a cotton gin.

a small hand-held toy, that whirls or spins when held against wind and makes a low rattling sound.

an instrument that makes a whir sound when rubbed or struck with a stick.

a building with machinery for a) grinding grain into flour or meal; b) grinding or crushing fruits or vegetables to press out the juice; c) manufacturing or processing something (as textiles); a mill.
a disease caused by contaminated water.
the structure containing a flue, extending above the roof of a mill or factory building, for smoke or fumes to escape; a chimney.
(dial.) a small, round cushion to lean on while sitting on a sofa, couch or divan.
the sixteenth part of seer, a measure of capacity.
the state of being distressed; pain, suffering, discomfort, etc.; distress.

the bushy moustaches.

anything given as security, as for a debt, performance of an action, etc.; pledge; pawn.
a man to whom property is mortgaged; a pawn-broker; mortgagee.
(a planet, that is believed to influence human lives or an evil spirit) to hold and influence (a person).
(a habit, obsession) to haunt or trouble to an abnormal degree.
a person who buys, esp. one who buys from or patronises, an establishment regularly; a customer.
any person with whom one has dealings.
a person in general (not in standard use).
a demand (as for a commodity in the market).
(sl.) a man who has sexual relation with a prostitute.
to gather or crowd, in large numbers, in or around (something or someone).
the act of swallowing (something) into the stomach.
a hill; a mountain.
a symbol for the number seven (eight, according to some).

a small mouse.
the herb Evolvulus alsinoides of Convolvulaceae family; the moon creeper.
the leguminous twining shrub Clitoria ternatea of Papilionaceae family with blue flowers, the root of which is used as a dieretic and demulcent; butterfly-pea.

a small hand-held toy, that makes a low rattling sound when spun.

the act of swallowing (something) into the stomach.

any of an order (Psittaciformes) of tropical or subtropical birds with a hooked bill, brightly coloured feathers, and feet having two toes pointing forward and two backward, some of which can learn to imitate human speech; a parrot.
